oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-02-07 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from February 7, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hank Snow (host/performer) and his Rainbow Ranch Boys, guest performer Carl Butler, and regular performers Archie Campbell, Tommy Jackson, Hank Garland, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1009th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Minnie Pearl; Carl Butler; Stringbean; Hank Snow; Tommy Jackson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Hank Snow introduces Minnie Pearl -- Comedy routine (Minnie Pearl) -- Prince Albert commercial (Minnie Pearl, Hank Snow) -- Prince Albert jingle -- Hank Snow introduces Carl Butler -- Oh, How I Miss You (Carl Butler) -- Hank Snow introduces Stringbean -- Run Little Rabbit Run (Stringbean) -- Grant Turner and Hank Snow announce his tour schedule -- Doggone That Train (Hank Snow) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Hank Snow) -- Camel Cigarettes jingle -- Network announcements (Grant Turner)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Garland, Hank, 1930-2004; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Minnie Pearl; Campbell, Archie; Smathers, Ben, -1990; Stoney Mountain Cloggers; Snow, Hank; Rainbow Ranch Boys; Butler, Carl
